title: Get all departments for User
name: get_alldepartment
description: By using this api, the front end will send nothing but the back end will strictly verify the user's access privilege. After that, the back end will send ordered average performances of all departments to the front end.

200.description: Return the context with ordered average performances of all departments.
Return all departments' entire performance in a descending order.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Example usage:

title: Get all students for User
name: get_allstudent
description: By using this api, the front end will send nothing but the back end will strictly verify the user's access privilege. After that, the back end will send all students' information to the front end.

200.description: Return the context with all students' performance.
Return all students' information in a special data structure.

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 Request Satisfied
{
  "建筑学院": [...],  // all information of students in "建筑学院"
  "机械工程学院": [...],  // all information of students in "机械工程学院"
  ...,
  "软件学院": [...]  // all information of students in "软件学院"
}

examples.title: Example usage:

title: Post a department to User
name: get_department
description: By using this api, the front end will send the department name to the back end. After that, the back end will post the whole students' information to the front end so that the admins can view all results. Update: the result is stored in an object which has all departments as properties and the required students' infos will be appended to the particular list, which is exactly the department property.

200.description: Return the context with all students' information in the requested department.
Return the information of all students in the requested department and organize them in a special data structure.

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 Request Satisfied
{
  "建筑学院": [],
  "机械工程学院": [],
  ...,
  "软件学院": [...]  // if request.body.Department = 71
}

examples.title: Example usage:

title: Regiser a User
name: post_register
description: By using this api, the front end will send the jwt back for the back end to strictly verify the user's access privilege and after that, the back end will using the user's inputted username and password to register a particular account for the user, which includes Student, Admin and Counsellor, and finally save the user infos to the data base.

Parameter.description: A context with user's jwt, inputted username and password, and his/her user type.
The identity of the user, which uses 0, 1 and 2 to represent Student, Admin and Counsellor.
The inputted username of the requesting user.
The inputted password of the requesting user.

200.description: Return the context with a 200 status.
Return 200 status to represent a successful regiser.

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 Successful Register
ctx.status = 200

403.description: Return 403 status to represent that the user has already existed.

404.description: Return 404 status to represent that the user's inputted username or password is not legal.

examples.title: Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 400 Illegal Username or Password
ctx.status = 400

examples.title: Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 403 User Existed
ctx.status = 403

examples.title: Example usage:

title: Reset User's name
name: reset_name
description: By using this api, the front end will send the user's new name and the back end will verify the user by jwt. After that, the back end will reset the user's name and save it to the data base.

200.description: Return the context with message 'successfully reset' to prompt the user a successful operation.
Prompt string 'successfully reset'.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Example usage:

title: Reset User's password
name: reset_password
description: By using this api, the front end will send the user's new password and the back end will verify the user by jwt. After that, the back end will reset the user's password and save it to the data base.

200.description: Return the context with message 'successfully reset' to prompt the user a successful operation.
Prompt string 'successfully reset'.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Example usage:

title: Reset User's username
name: reset_username
description: By using this api, the front end will send the user's new username and the back end will verify the user by jwt. After that, the back end will reset the user's username and save it to the data base. Note: in this api, the name and password are used to find the objected user, instead of using username.

200.description: Return the context with message 'successfully reset' to prompt the user a successful operation.
Prompt string 'successfully reset'.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Example usage:

title: Handin Student's answers
name: handin
description: By using this api, the front end will tell the back end the student's username and his/her answers. After that, the back end will calculate his/her spent time. If the spent time is over 30 mins, we do not accept this answer paper. If the spent time is legal, this api will check his/her answers and update his/her score to the data base.

Parameter.description: A context with Username and his/her answers.
The answers of the objected student to his/her test paper.

200.description: Return the context with the objected student's score.
Return the score of the objected student.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 403 Over Time or Test Finished
ctx.status = 403

examples.title: Example usage:

title: Post a test paper to Student
name: post
description: By using this api, the front end can post a test paper for the objected student. If the student has not answered any paper, a randomly constructed paper should be posted. If the student has answered a paper, the state 403 will be responsed.

200.description: Return the context with a randomly chosen paper.
Return a randomly chosen paper in response body.
Return the successful status.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 403 Test Paper Finished
ctx.status = 403

examples.title: Example usage:

title: Output Student's all products
name: result
description: By using this api, the front end will tell the back end the student's username. After that, the back end will access the data base and show all products of the test to the user, including the student's information, the test paper, his/her answers, his/her score and the correct answers of the test paper.

200.description: Return the context with all test products.
Return the test paper of the student.
Return the choice answers of the student and the correct choice answers of his/her test paper.
Return the judgment answers of the student and the correct judgment answers of his/her test paper.
Return the score of the objected student.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Example usage:

title: Correct Student's answers
name: result1
description: By using this api, the front end will tell the back end the student's username. After that, the back end will access the data base and show the correct answers of his/her test paper.

200.description: Return the context with the correct answers of the objected student's test paper.
Return the correct answers in the response body.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Example usage:

title: Start Student's test
name: start
description: By using this api, the front end will tell the back end the student's username. After that, the back end will record his/her start time, which is used to supervise his/her total test time, and allow the student to start his/her test.

200.description: Return the context with a message which is to tell the student to start his/her test.
Return the message which is 'start testing' in response body.

examples.title: Success-Response:
Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 403 Student Not Found
ctx.body = error

examples.title: Example usage:

title: User Login
name: post_login
description: By using this api, the front end will tell the back end about the information of the user who is requesting login, which will include the user's inputted username and password. After that, the back end will verify his/her inputted username and password. If the request is allowed, the back end will send a 200 status with a json web token to the front end.

Parameter.description: A context with user's inputted username and password.
The identity of the user, which uses 0, 1 and 2 to represent Student, Admin and Counsellor.
The inputted username of the requesting user.
The inputted password of the requesting user.

200.description: Return the context with the user's name, the json web token, which is used to further session, and the status 200. Update: the departments of students and counsellors are also included.
Return the username of the user.
Return the json web token of the objected user.
Return the department of the user.
Return the 200 status to represent successful login request.

examples.title: Success-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 200 Successful Login
{
  Name: user.name,
  Token: 'Bearer ' + token,
  [Department: user.department,]
  [Score: student.score]
}
ctx.status = 200

403.description: Return 403 status to represent that the password inputted by the user is incorrect.

404.description: Return 404 status to represent that the user is not in the data base, which may be because the user has not registered.

examples.title: Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 403 Wrong Password
ctx.status = 403

examples.title: Error-Response:
examples.content:
HTTP/1.1 404 User Not Found
ctx.status = 404

examples.title: Example usage:
